book.description: 57-PHM-asv.sfm The American Standard Version of the Holy Bible (1901) Tuesday, September 12, 2006

toc1: The Epistle of Paul to Philemon

mt1: The Epistle of Paul to Philemon

contents.verseText: Paul, a prisoner of Christ Jesus, and Timothy our brother, to Philemon our beloved and fellow-worker,
contents: Paul, a prisoner of Christ Jesus, and Timothy our brother, to Philemon our beloved and fellow-worker,

contents.verseText: and to Apphia our sister, and to Archippus our fellow-soldier, and to the church in thy house:
contents: and to Apphia our sister, and to Archippus our fellow-soldier, and to the church in thy house:

contents.verseText: Grace to you and peace from God our Father and the Lord Jesus Christ.
contents: Grace to you and peace from God our Father and the Lord Jesus Christ.

contents.verseText: I thank my God always, making mention of thee in my prayers,
contents: I thank my God always, making mention of thee in my prayers,

contents.verseText: hearing of thy love, and of the faith which thou hast toward the Lord Jesus, and toward all the saints;
contents: hearing of thy love, and of the faith which thou hast toward the Lord Jesus, and toward all the saints;

contents.verseText: that the fellowship of thy faith may become effectual, in the knowledge of every good thing which is in you, unto Christ.
contents: that the fellowship of thy faith may become effectual, in the knowledge of every good thing which is in you, unto Christ.

contents.verseText: For I had much joy and comfort in thy love, because the hearts of the saints have been refreshed through thee, brother.
contents: For I had much joy and comfort in thy love, because the hearts of the saints have been refreshed through thee, brother.

contents.verseText: Wherefore, though I have all boldness in Christ to enjoin thee that which is befitting,
contents: Wherefore, though I have all boldness in Christ to enjoin thee that which is befitting,

contents.verseText: yet for love’s sake I rather beseech, being such a one as Paul the aged, and now a prisoner also of Christ Jesus:
contents: yet for love’s sake I rather beseech, being such a one as Paul the aged, and now a prisoner also of Christ Jesus:

contents.verseText: I beseech thee for my child, whom I have begotten in my bonds, Onesimus,
contents: I beseech thee for my child, whom I have begotten in my bonds, Onesimus,

contents.verseText: who once was unprofitable to thee, but now is profitable to thee and to me:
contents: who once was unprofitable to thee, but now is profitable to thee and to me:

contents.verseText: whom I have sent back to thee in his own person, that is, my very heart:
contents: whom I have sent back to thee in his own person, that is, my very heart:

contents.verseText: whom I would fain have kept with me, that in thy behalf he might minister unto me in the bonds of the gospel:
contents: whom I would fain have kept with me, that in thy behalf he might minister unto me in the bonds of the gospel:

contents.verseText: but without thy mind I would do nothing; that thy goodness should not be as of necessity, but of free will.
contents: but without thy mind I would do nothing; that thy goodness should not be as of necessity, but of free will.

contents.verseText: For perhaps he was therefore parted from thee for a season, that thou shouldest have him for ever;
contents: For perhaps he was therefore parted
for a season, that thou shouldest have him for ever;

contents.verseText: no longer as a servant, but more than a servant, a brother beloved, specially to me, but how much rather to thee, both in the flesh and in the Lord.
contents: no longer as a servant, but more than a servant, a brother beloved, specially to me, but how much rather to thee, both in
the flesh and in the Lord.

contents.verseText: If then thou countest me a partner, receive him as myself.
contents: If then thou countest me a partner, receive him as myself.

contents.verseText: But if he hath wronged thee at all, or oweth thee aught, put that to mine account;
contents: But if he hath wronged thee at all, or oweth
aught, put that to mine account;

contents.verseText: I Paul write it with mine own hand, I will repay it: that I say not unto thee that thou owest to me even thine own self besides.
contents: I Paul write it with mine own hand, I will repay it: that I say not unto thee that thou owest to me even thine own self
besides.

contents.verseText: Yea, brother, let me have joy of thee in the Lord: refresh my heart in Christ.
contents: Yea, brother, let me have joy of thee in the Lord: refresh my heart in Christ.

contents.verseText: Having confidence in thine obedience I write unto thee, knowing that thou wilt do even beyond what I say.
contents: Having confidence in thine obedience I write unto thee, knowing that thou wilt do even beyond what I say.

contents.verseText: But withal prepare me also a lodging: for I hope that through your prayers I shall be granted unto you.
contents: But withal prepare me also a lodging: for I hope that through your prayers I shall be granted unto you.

contents.verseText: Epaphras, my fellow-prisoner in Christ Jesus, saluteth thee;
contents: Epaphras, my fellow-prisoner in Christ Jesus, saluteth thee;

contents.verseText: and so do Mark, Aristarchus, Demas, Luke, my fellow-workers.
contents: Mark, Aristarchus, Demas, Luke, my fellow-workers.

contents.verseText: The grace of our Lord Jesus Christ be with your spirit. Amen.
contents: The grace of our Lord Jesus Christ be with your spirit. Amen.
